phrases: I was skiing in Vermont last weekend and I caught my ski when I was coming off the lift and I fell and my knee popped and it's hurt ever since.
it hurts on the outside but it also feels it won't hold my weight
it’s been hurting ever since
the feeling of instability and buckling.
I had to be taken down by the ski patrol I was unable to bear weight.
I was immediately able to bend it but not really
somewhat [able to straighten] but it really hurts when I try to straighten all the way.
no numbing or tingling in [my] toes
can feel [my] toes.
taking ibuprofen
is helping somewhat
edema and an effusion over the knee,
pain to palpation of the lateral knee,
decreased flexion and extension,
positive Lachman sign.
x-ray of the knee did not show any bony abnormality
concerned that you have ruptured your ACL.
order a knee MRI to confirm,
continue ibuprofen 600 to 800 mg every 8 hours,
brace to support the knee.
active with skiing and taking care of her 4-year-old twins
get back into running.
husband is home with me but he also works a job where he is gone quite a bit.
regular heart rate and rhythm, clear lungs,
palpable dorsalis pedis and posterior tibial pulse,
no leg edema in the ankle.
see you again soon
